thread.title: Record-setting defense leads Houston volleyball past Tulane
thread.title_full: Record-setting defense leads Houston volleyball past Tulane

author: From our community
title: Record-setting defense leads Houston volleyball past Tulane
text:
Record-setting defense leads Houston volleyball past Tulane From our community Houston Community Newspapers NEW ORLEANS, La. – Senior libero Olivia O’Dell’s record-setting night led Houston Volleyball to an exciting five-set win (25-23, 20-25, 25-13, 23-25, 15-13) over Tulane Wednesday night. The Cougars are now 14-3, 4-1 in the American Athletic Conference while the Green Wave drops to 7-10, 1-4 in league play. O’Dell broke the school record for most digs in a match with her career-high 47 digs in the five-set victory. Her performance Wednesday night is now the nations best showing of the season in a five-set match. The Cougars posted a season high 110 total digs in the match. “Olivia had an outstanding performance that really kept us in the match tonight,” Head Coach Kaddie Platt said. “She has great ability to read attackers and leads our team with her consistent, relentless effort ondefense. She sets a high standard that is an absolute necessity to our team's success.” After splitting the match 1-1 heading into the half, the Cougars picked up a 25-13 win in set three to take a 2-1 lead in the match.However, Tulane was relentless in the fourth set to force a decisive fifth set. Both teams battled point-for-point in the final set, but Houston took a 9-6 lead before Tulane was forced to take a timeout. The Green Wave gained momentum and tied the match 13-13, causing Houston to use its second timeout. a kill by freshman Brookah Palmer and a huge solo block by redshirt freshman Chenelle Walker sealed the win for the Cougars. Palmer recorded her seventh double-double of the season with a career best 31 kills and 13 digs. Her career best kills performance is tied for the fifth best performance in school history for a five set match. Sophomore Keandra McCardell posted her sixth double-double of the season and 14 th of her career with 58 assists and 18 digs. 
Junior transfer Claire McCown posted a season best 12 kills against the Green Wave while Walker led the Cougars hitting .273 with 10 kills and seven blocks. 
Houston Volleyball enjoys the rest of the week off before heading to Greenville, N.C., to play East Carolina on Sunday at noon.
